args.natural_language_statement: Suppose X -> Y and Z -> Y are universal covering maps. Prove that X is isomorphic to Z as a covering of Y, i.e. there is a unique map X -> Z making the triangle X -> Y and Z -> Y commute.

retrieved_examples.nl: If G is a group and H is a subgroup of finite index, then there exists a normal subgroup N of G contained in H with finite index.
retrieved_examples.lean:
import Mathlib

variable {G : Type*} [Group G] (H : Subgroup G) (h : H.index < ∞)

theorem exists_normal_subgroup_of_finite_index :
  ∃ N : Subgroup G, N.normal ∧ N ≤ H ∧ (Subgroup.index N) < ∞ := by sorry

retrieved_examples.nl: If f : X → Y is a continuous bijection from a compact space X to a Hausdorff space Y, then f is a homeomorphism.
retrieved_examples.lean:
import Mathlib

variable {X Y : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] [TopologicalSpace Y]

variable (f : X → Y) (hf : Continuous f) (hb : Function.Bijective f) (hc : CompactSpace X) (hh : T2Space Y)

theorem continuous_bijective_compact_hausdorff_is_homeomorphism :
  IsHomeomorph (Homeomorph.ofContinuousBijective f hf hb) := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

variables {X Y Z : Type*}
  [TopologicalSpace X] [TopologicalSpace Y] [TopologicalSpace Z]

-- Abstract predicates for covering maps and simple connectivity
variable (IsCovering : ∀ {E B : Type*} [TopologicalSpace E] [TopologicalSpace B], (E → B) → Prop)
variable (IsSimplyConnected : ∀ (E : Type*) [TopologicalSpace E], Prop)

def IsUniversalCovering {E B : Type*} [TopologicalSpace E] [TopologicalSpace B] (f : E → B) : Prop :=
  IsCovering (f := f) ∧ IsSimplyConnected E

/-- Suppose X → Y and Z → Y are universal covering maps. Then X is isomorphic to Z as a covering of Y,
    i.e. there is a unique map X → Z making the triangle X → Y and Z → Y commute. -/
theorem universal_coverings_unique_up_to_iso {p : X → Y} {q : Z → Y}
  (hp : IsUniversalCovering (p : X → Y)) (hq : IsUniversalCovering (q : Z → Y)) :
  ∃! (f : X → Z), (q ∘ f) = p := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

variables {X Y Z : Type*}
  [TopologicalSpace X] [TopologicalSpace Y] [TopologicalSpace Z]

-- Abstract predicates for covering maps and simple connectivity
variable (IsCovering : ∀ {E B : Type*} [TopologicalSpace E] [TopologicalSpace B], (E → B) → Prop)
variable (IsSimplyConnected : ∀ (E : Type*) [TopologicalSpace E], Prop)

def IsUniversalCovering {E B : Type*} [TopologicalSpace E] [TopologicalSpace B] (f : E → B) : Prop :=
  IsCovering (f := f) ∧ IsSimplyConnected E

/-- Suppose X → Y and Z → Y are universal covering maps. Then X is isomorphic to Z as a covering of Y,
    i.e. there is a unique map X → Z making the triangle X → Y and Z → Y commute. -/
theorem universal_coverings_unique_up_to_iso {p : X → Y} {q : Z → Y}
  (hp : IsUniversalCovering (p : X → Y)) (hq : IsUniversalCovering (q : Z → Y)) :
  ∃! (f : X → Z), (q ∘ f) = p := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

variable {X Y Z : Type*}
variable [TopologicalSpace X] [TopologicalSpace Y] [TopologicalSpace Z]

-- Abstract predicates for covering maps and simple connectivity
variable (IsCoveringMap : ∀ {E B : Type*} [TopologicalSpace E] [TopologicalSpace B], (E → B) → Prop)
variable (IsSimplyConnected : ∀ (E : Type*) [TopologicalSpace E], Prop)

def IsUniversalCovering {E B : Type*} [TopologicalSpace E] [TopologicalSpace B] (f : E → B) : Prop :=
  IsCoveringMap (f) ∧ IsSimplyConnected E

/-- Suppose X → Y and Z → Y are universal covering maps. Then X is isomorphic to Z as a covering of Y,
    i.e. there is a unique map X → Z making the triangle X → Y and Z → Y commute. -/
theorem universal_coverings_unique_up_to_iso {p : X → Y} {q : Z → Y}
  (hp : IsUniversalCovering IsCoveringMap IsSimplyConnected (p : X → Y))
  (hq : IsUniversalCovering IsCoveringMap IsSimplyConnected (q : Z → Y)) :
  ∃! (f : X → Z), (q ∘ f) = p := by sorry

import Mathlib

variable {X Y Z : Type*}
variable [TopologicalSpace X] [TopologicalSpace Y] [TopologicalSpace Z]

-- Predicate for universal covering maps (abstracted)
variable (IsUniversalCovering : ∀ {E B : Type*} [TopologicalSpace E] [TopologicalSpace B], (E → B) → Prop)

/-- Suppose X → Y and Z → Y are universal covering maps. Then X is isomorphic to Z as a covering of Y,
    i.e. there is a unique map X → Z making the triangle X → Y and Z → Y commute. -/
theorem universal_coverings_unique_up_to_iso {p : X → Y} {q : Z → Y}
  (hp : IsUniversalCovering (p : X → Y)) (hq : IsUniversalCovering (q : Z → Y)) :
  ∃! (f : X → Z), (q ∘ f) = p := by sorry

import Mathlib

variable {X Y Z : Type*}
variable [TopologicalSpace X] [TopologicalSpace Y] [TopologicalSpace Z]

/-- Predicate for a universal covering map (abstracted). -/
def IsUniversalCovering {E B : Type*} [TopologicalSpace E] [TopologicalSpace B] (f : E → B) : Prop :=
  True

/-- Suppose X → Y and Z → Y are universal covering maps. Then X is isomorphic to Z as a covering of Y,
    i.e. there is a unique map X → Z making the triangle X → Y and Z → Y commute. -/
theorem universal_coverings_unique_up_to_iso {p : X → Y} {q : Z → Y}
  (hp : IsUniversalCovering (p : X → Y)) (hq : IsUniversalCovering (q : Z → Y)) :
  ∃! (f : X → Z), (q ∘ f) = p := by sorry
